setup.question: Why were the Venus women transfixed by the Earthmen?
answers: The Earthmen were much more attractive and had real facial hair.
They felt abandoned by their own men who had obsessions with war and little time for them.

Text.text: B might need a bit more evidence, but its specificity means its a little more appealing. A, is simpler, so a straight up quote could make this very simpler.

The story centers on O'Rielly, a worker aboard a spaceship. Earth and Venus are locked in a fragile peace, because Venutian women are extremely attracted to Earthmen, and Earthmen are extremely attracted to the Venutian women. 

Answer B is factually wrong because Venutian men aren't actually obsessed with war - they just play fake war games for fun sometimes:

. So there are two kinds of war being discussed - the "war" in the story isn't real war. 

Constructive evidence for beards is distributed - will give ev next round.

Trillium is a Venusian woman who illegally stows away in the burner room of an Earth ship, as part of a revolutionary plot to get the attention of Earth's Madame President and plead with Earth to stop buying from Venus and funding their wars.

In confrontation, when Mr. President of Venus justifies their wars, Trillium says: "

B gave a highly specific and accurate quote. A claimed to have evidence for their own side, but non strategically opted to wait till next round? 
On A's quote, it doesn't really prove that war is fake, just its not dangerous.
And B's evidence pretty much cleared both A's credibility and proved the B point.
Originally gonna give it another round but this is looking very over.
just because the war is a game doesn't mean the venus women can't be pissed off about their men being obsessed with it.

answers.reason for outcome: evidence lined up very straightforwardly for A
B's evidence was very compelling + A's logic supported B's point.
I lost this debate because there was pretty clear evidence for the other side, and only very tangential evidence for my answer.
The judges didn't buy A's semantic argument, and I came in with solid evidence for my side as well as a refutation of A's side.
